## The Rankine cycle

:::{.absolute}
:::{.fragment}
$$\Delta H_{pump}=-W_{s}=V\Delta P$$
:::
:::{.fragment}

The process from **b** to **c** is now isobaric instead of isothermal.
<br/>
<br/>

:::
:::{.fragment}
Pump from **a** to **b** now only compresses liquid.
:::
:::

## Rankine Cycle Example

::: {.absolute}

:::{.fragment}
A steam power plant operates with steam entering the turbine at 80
bar and 500$^{\circ}$C. The condenser operates at 44$^{\circ}$C.
:::

1.  Calculate the thermal efficiency.
2.  What is the water circulation rate for a net power generation of 80 MW?

:::{.fragment}
Data needed from the steam tables:
:::

:::{.fragment}
@ 44$^{\circ}$C and 0.091124 bar: $\hat{H}_{l}$,
$\hat{S}_{l}$, $\tilde{V}_{l}$
:::

:::{.fragment}

@ 500$^{\circ}$C and 80 bar: $\hat{H},\hat{S}$
:::

:::

##

At 44$^{\circ}$C and 0.091124 bar
<br/>



:::{style="font-size:85px;"}
:::{.fragment}
$\hat{V_{l}}=0.0010095\frac{m^{3}}{kg}$ $\quad$ $\hat{H}_{l}=184.25\frac{kJ}{kg}$ $\quad$ $\hat{H}_{v}=2580.6\frac{kJ}{kg}$
:::

:::{.fragment}
$\hspace{20cm}$ $\hat{S}_{l}=0.62545\frac{kJ}{kg~K}$ $\quad$ $\hat{S}_{v}=8.1815\frac{kJ}{kg~K}$
:::

:::
<br/>

:::{.fragment}
At 500$^{\circ}$C and 80 bar
:::

:::{style="font-size:85px;"}
:::{.fragment}
$\hat{H}=3399.5\frac{kJ}{kg}$
<br/>

:::

:::{.fragment}
$\hat{S}=6.7266\frac{kJ}{kg~K}$
:::
:::

## 
### Pump


:::{style="font-size:85px;"}
::: {.absolute left=3% top=5%}

:::{.fragment}
$$\frac{\dot{W_{s}}}{\dot{m}}=\Delta\hat{H}=\hat{V}\Delta P$$
:::
:::

:::{.fragment}
::: {.absolute left=3% top=20%}
$$=0.0010095\frac{m^{3}}{kg}(8000~kPa-9.1124~kPa)=8.067\frac{kJ}{kg}$$
:::
:::

:::{.fragment}
::: {.absolute left=3% top=35%}
$$\hat{H}_{b}=\hat{H}_{a}+\Delta\hat{H}=184.25\frac{kJ}{kg}+8.067\frac{kJ}{kg}=192.3\frac{kJ}{kg}$$
:::
:::
:::

<br/>
<br/>
<br/>
<br/>
<br/>

<br/>
<br/>
<br/>

:::{.fragment}
### Boiler
:::

:::{.fragment}
:::{style="font-size:85px;"}
::: {.absolute left=3% top=65%}
$$\Delta\hat{H}=\frac{\dot{Q}}{\dot{m}}=\hat{H}_{c}-\hat{H}_{b}=3399.5\frac{kJ}{kg}-192.3\frac{kJ}{kg}=3207.2\frac{kJ}{kg}$$
:::
:::
:::

## 
### Turbine


:::{style="font-size:80px;"}
:::{.fragment}
::: {.absolute left=3% top=5%}
$$\frac{\dot{W_{s}}}{\dot{m}}=\Delta\hat{H}$$
:::
:::

:::{.fragment}
::: {.absolute left=3% top=20%}
$$\Delta\hat{S}=0\Rightarrow\hat{S}_{c}=\hat{S}_{d}$$
:::
:::

:::{.fragment}
::: {.absolute left=3% top=35%}
$$6.7266=x(8.1815)+(1-x)(0.62545) \quad x=\frac{6.10115}{7.55605}=0.80745$$
:::
:::

:::{.fragment}
::: {.absolute left=3% top=50%}
$$\hat{H}_{d}=x\hat{H}_{v}+(1-x)\hat{H}_{l}$$
:::
:::

:::{.fragment}
::: {.absolute left=3% top=65%}
$$=0.8075(2580.6\frac{kJ}{kg})+(1-0.8075)(184.25\frac{kJ}{kg})=2119.3\frac{kJ}{kg}$$
:::
:::

:::{.fragment}
::: {.absolute left=3% top=80%}
$$\Delta\hat{H}=2119.3\frac{kJ}{kg}-3399.5\frac{kJ}{kg}=-1280.2\frac{kJ}{kg}$$
:::
:::
:::

## 
### Efficiency

:::{style="font-size:90px;"}
::: {.absolute left=3% top=10%}
:::{.fragment}
$$\eta=\frac{-W_{net}}{Q_{bst}}=\frac{1280.2\frac{kJ}{kg}-8.067\frac{kJ}{kg}}{3207.2\frac{kJ}{kg}}=0.3967=39.7\%$$
:::
:::
:::


<br/>
<br/>
<br/><br/><br/>

:::{.fragment}
### Flow Rate
:::

:::{.fragment}

:::{style="font-size:90px;"}
::: {.absolute left=3% top=50%}
$$-\dot{W}_{net}=80,000\frac{kJ}{s}=-\dot{m}W_{net}$$
:::
:::

:::{.fragment}
::: {.absolute left=3% top=65%}
$$\dot{m}=\frac{-\dot{W}_{net}}{-W_{net}}=\frac{80,000\frac{kJ}{s}}{1280.2\frac{kJ}{kg}-8.067\frac{kJ}{kg}}=62.89\frac{kg}{s}$$
:::
:::
:::

## Up the Realism

::: {.absolute}

:::{.fragment}
A more realistic Rankine cycle would include a turbine efficiency and
a pump efficiency.
:::
:::{.fragment}
:::{style="font-size:90px;"}
$$\dot{W}_{s\cdot actual}=\eta_{turbine}\dot{W}_{s\cdot isentropic} \qquad \dot{W}_{s\cdot actual}=\frac{\dot{W}_{s\cdot isentropic}}{\eta_{pump}}$$
:::
:::
:::
